description: A powerful and highly addictive stimulant drug whose use is tightly restricted throughout the world due to its extreme danger and addictive properties. Caesar Clown disguised this drug in candy to deliberately addict the kidnapped children.

firstAppearance.context: Chopper discovers that the children have been given NHC10 and are suffering from withdrawal symptoms

effects: Severe withdrawal symptoms including pain, sweating, and violent behavior
Used as a control mechanism to keep victims imprisoned
dangers: Withdrawal causes severe physical and psychological distress
Can turn victims violent during withdrawal
Tightly restricted worldwide due to danger

significance: Reveals the extent of Caesar Clown's cruelty and serves as a key plot device in the Punk Hazard arc. The drug addiction scheme demonstrates one of the most morally reprehensible acts by any One Piece villain - deliberately addicting kidnapped children.
notes: NHC10 is an anime-original designation. The manga refers to the substance as a powerful stimulant but does not provide the specific drug name.
